salaryFormula.description: Regional baseline adjusted by cost-of-living pressure

graduateMethodology._verificationNote: Regional totals (officialStem, coreICT) are official DGEEC NUTS II figures (2023/24). City-level officialStem and coreICT values are proportional estimates derived from these regional totals, distributed by institutional size. These are marked approximate=true and prefixed with ≈ in the UI. digitalStemPlus is an internal calculation (INCoDe.2030 multiplier) and was already consistent.

officialStem.description: DGEEC/Eurostat classification: Natural Sciences, ICT, Engineering

digitalStemPlus.description: Hiring-relevant talent pool: STEM + CTeSP + Adjacent programs

coreICT.description: Pure CS/IT specialists (subset of Digital STEM+)

source.provider: Proportional estimate from DGEEC regional total
source.methodology: City share of regional DGEEC total, distributed proportionally by institutional size
officialStem × INCoDe.2030 multiplier
(coreICT / digitalStemPlus) × 100
(coreICT / officialStem) × 100

source.provider: Proportional estimate from DGEEC regional total
source.methodology: City share of regional DGEEC total, distributed proportionally by institutional size
COL-adjusted regional baseline

source.provider: Cushman & Wakefield, JLL Portugal, Idealista, AI fact-checked
source.methodology: Derived from multiple real estate sources and cross-verified via AI fact-check consensus

source.provider: Idealista, Numbeo, Cushman & Wakefield, JLL Portugal, AI fact-checked
source.methodology: Derived from multiple rental listing and cost-of-living sources, cross-verified via AI fact-check consensus

source.note: New York = 100. Where direct Numbeo data was unavailable, Numbeo-style estimates were derived from regional cost patterns and AI fact-checked.

source.methodology: City share of regional DGEEC total, distributed proportionally by institutional size
